intro: Auriculardisia limonensis, commonly known as the lemon-scented auriculardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, lemon-scented leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are elliptical and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Auriculardisia limonensis is typically found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
